_header: Our marvelous God that most is of might
Note:
For other versions, see 4730 and Utley (1972)
XUtley, Francis Lee. “Dialogues, Debates, and Catechisms.” In A Manual of the Writings of Middle English, 1050-150 Vol. 3, fascicle 7. New Haven: Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1972: 669-745, 829-902, 688-700, 864-5.
Title(s): Spiritus Guidonis; The Gast of Gy

CamMagPep2125.First Lines:
oWre merueyllous god þat most ys of myȝtalwey he
                    wurcheþ to fastne oure fey…
CamMagPep2125.Last Lines:
…And graunte vs to lyue as þy wille yseuere þe while
                    we beþ lyuynge
CamMagPep2125.Note: Written two lines of verse per line of text in M.

LeedsBro501.First Lines:
LOrde and god alway lovere of all mankyndeYs wont wondrys to werke
                    al day al oure feyth to amendeA thowsend ȝere ccc xxti and
                    thre be þat þe boke makyth spellOn this half gods natyuyte to
                    telle a wondyr thing be fell…
LeedsBro501.Last Lines:
…Mercyfull god graunt vs þat blys all wey there in to haue
                    duellyngDresse vs to go as thi wyl ys Euer whil we be here levyngAmen
                    to that ioye he vs bryngWhen we make oure endyng
LeedsBro501.Note: Written two lines of verse per line of text in M.
LeedsBro501.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth a notabyll matere and a gret myracule don be oure lord ihesu
                    cryst and shewyd In the ȝeer of his incarnacion M ccc xxiii and in the xvi
                    day of decembyr in the Cete of Aleste Whiche myracule ys of a certeyn man that
                    was callyd Gy… (f. 92)
LeedsBro501.Editions:
Lightbown,  J. A. 
             “A Shorter Metrical Version of The Gast of Gy.” 
             Modern Language Review
         47 (1952): 323-9: 323-9.
